THE LAKE OF TAXODIUM

At the end of the "Dantesque infernal" path of the thermal garden, there is a last lake, very different from the previous ones. It is a mirror of hot water of anthropic origin. In fact, it does not form part of the spa garden design designed by the architect Giuseppe Jappelli. The lake was built at the beginning of the 1900s by the will of the Emo counts who wanted to widen the water transit channel by creating this last basin. The difference compared to the previous round lakes is mainly given by its rectangular shape. Around the lake, a very particular tree backdrop was created which was in vogue at the time: it is Taxodium distichum. The tree belongs to the conifer family, which brings with it a rarity: in the autumn it strips of the needles and twigs that support them. For this reason Taxodium is also called bald cypress. The conifer comes from across the ocean, it is in fact native to the swamps of North America, and is found above all in the state of Florida. The taxodium loves water environments and lives mainly in oxygen-poor soils. In order to "breathe" in this particular environment, it emits protuberances from its roots that can be observed on the shores of the lake. These are root tubercles emerging from the soil and water, called pneumatophores. They perform the function of oxygenation, that is, they guarantee the supply of oxygen to the plant even in periods of flooding of the soil. The bark has a characteristic reddish colour, the same color that the needles take on before falling from the tree at the first hints of winter. oxygen bubbles coming out of the thermal spring located on the right side of the lake.
